item.title: Melissa add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Critics who treat 'adult' as a term of approval, instead of as a merely descriptive term, cannot be adult themselves. To be concerned about being grown up, to admire the grown up because it is grown up, to blush at the suspicion of being childish; these things are the marks of childhood and adolescence. And in childhood and adolescence they are, in moderation, healthy symptoms. Young things ought to want to grow. But to carry on into middle life or even into early manhood this concern about being adult is a mark of really arrested development. When I was ten, I read fairy tales in secret and would have been ashamed if I had been found doing so. Now that I am fifty I read them openly. When I became a man I put away childish things, including the fear of childishness and the desire to be very grown up." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Eileen Kennedy-Moore
item.description: "Potential is not an endpoint but a capacity to grow and learn." -- Eileen Kennedy-Moore

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Melissa add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Melissa add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one’s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is to not stop questioning." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Melissa add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Melissa add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath
